pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Sunday, June 13, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Cornwall, United Kingdom

Private meetings.

8:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Prime Minister of Japan, Suga Yoshihide.

Japan Bilateral Meeting Room
Carbis Bay Estate Hotel

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity

9:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Working Session V with Outreach Countries entitled “Building Back Together: Open Societies and Economies”.

Plenary Room, Second Floor
Carbis Bay Estate Hotel

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster, host photographer, and official photographer only

11:25 a.m. The Prime Minister will participate in the G7 Working Session VI with Outreach Countries entitled “Building Back Greener: Climate and Nature”.

Plenary Room, Second Floor
Carbis Bay Estate Hotel

Note for media:

  • Host broadcaster, host photographer, and official photographer only   

3:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability.

Room 4, Ground Floor
Tregenna Castle

Note for media:

  • Open coverage

7:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Brussels, Belgium.           

Cornwall Airport Newquay

Closed to media.

Brussels, Belgium

10:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will arrive in Brussels, Belgium.            

Melsbroek Military Airbase

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity
